Authors: @nothsa and Artem Gordon PDF version   Three-Point Summary ‘What is the most relevant information on the forums this week for MKR and Dai holders?’ 1. Rune submits the Core Tokenomics breakdown for Endgame SubDAOs, previously called MetaDAOs. 2. Two Special Purpose Funds have been proposed: 1. A 5M DAI SPF for establishing a legal self-insurance fund, and 2. A 500k DAI SPF for the Viridian Cluster to manage ongoing RWA tasks. 3. Governance Communications, Sidestream Auction Services, and ImmuneFi Security Core Units are all officially submitted for offboarding. Forum Recap:          Announcements & Updates  Change of Ownership of the Ambassador Program’s Multi-Sig  @kat, who led the Ambassador Program, has decided to step down from her role. She has performed a great job at building the team and informing the Latin America community. In effort to keep the program going, @Sebix of GovAlpha is requesting to be made the multisig wallet owner.    Active Discussions & Proposals  Endgame  Final Endgame Tokenomics  In this post, @rune outlines some of the fundamental parameters and features of the latest and “likely final” iteration of Endgame tokenomics, from yearly emissions (70k MKR) to Core SubDAO Tokenomics.  Potential rename of MetaDAOs to Maker SubDAOs  As part of an ongoing effort to simplify and improve the language used in the Endgame Plan, a suggestion to rename MetaDAOs “Maker SubDAOs” has surfaced. The advantage of this name is that it is somewhat self-explanatory and SubDAOs are a known concept, lowering the explanatory burden. On the other hand, the term’s technical nature may need to be more appealing from a marketing perspective.  LongForWisdom’s Suggestions on WIP Scope Framework  @LongForWisdom made a series of in-depth suggestions for improving Rune’s WIP Scope Framework draft. First, he suggested easy-to-read formatting for the eventual MIP, viewable here. This was followed by detailed suggestions regarding the language of the framework aimed at improving clarity and unambiguity.  Resource and Clarity for Core Units’ Transitions into Endgame  Recognized Delegate @Doo_StableLab shared a post seeking clarity on recent budget rejections and advocating for the creation of resources to help Core Units transition into structures more suited to the Endgame Plan.  Core Unit Offboarding  Sidestream Auction Services - Core Unit Offboarding  This MIP offboards the Sidestream Auction Services Core Unit, which had its proposed budget rejected by an on-chain poll earlier this month. The Core Unit was set up to “improve the security, transparency, and accessibility of the Maker Protocol by providing and maintaining auction services through open-source development.”  ImmuneFi Security - Core Unit Offboarding  The ImmuneFi Security Core Unit also rejected its budget proposal and is slated for offboarding. The team’s stated mission was to “systematically improve security for builders, end users, and other stakeholders in the Maker Ecosystem by providing both reactive and proactive security services.”  Governance Communications Offboarding  This MIP offboards the GovComms Core Unit in the wake of its rejected budget proposal. It outlines the deliverables and responsibilities, explains how the CU will be wound down over the next two months, and suggests golden parachute and retroactive MKR compensation amounts. A governance vote will take place on Monday regarding winding down spending permissions and approving final expenditures for administrative and offboarding work in January. GovComms hopes to re-enter the community as an ecosystem actor once Endgame is underway.  SubDAOs  SPF: Proof-of-Performance for Viridian Cluster  This MIP establishes a Special Purpose Fund of 500k DAI for the Viridian Cluster to fund the due diligence, completion, and ongoing management and monitoring of:  MIP65 Monetalis Clydesdale: Liquid Bond Strategy & Execution MIP81: Coinbase USDC Institutional Rewards MIP88: Monetalis - Redwood Friesian Any other MIPs submitted in the next six months for which Monetalis will act as Arranger  The fund would enable Maker to continue working on important RWA projects before MetaDAOs launch and provides an opportunity for the community to evaluate the Viridian Cluster’s performance and potential as a Protector MetaDAO.  Protector MetaDAO Operationalisation  Protector MetaDAOs (PMDs) are Endgame entities tasked with allocating collateral to Real World Assets, protecting Maker against physical and legal threats, and carrying out the responsibilities associated with part ownership of RWA Maker Vaults. In this extensive post, @Allan_Pedersen lays out the fundamental requirements for getting PMDs off the ground. Operating System & Key Concepts This section runs through the risk parameters that must be addressed before a PMD can be launched. This Portfolio Risk Requirement Framework should “provide appropriate safeguards, but should also propel DAI into a state of portfolio design and control that should be recognizable as ‘safe’ by international regulators.” A sample framework is available here. The section describes frameworks for stress testing, reporting, accounting and definitions, documentation, monitoring and enforcement, and collateral evaluation. Protector MetaDAO Implementation Project This section covers considerations relevant to implementing the frameworks outlined in the previous section:   Building and deploying simultaneously  Maker will likely need to “assemble the plane while flying it.”    Assembling and activating resources  This is the first step in operationalizing PMDs.    Communication and engagement  Sufficient Maker community communication and engagement will be important to the success of PMDs.    RWA council challenges: quality build allows quality hiring  A high-caliber RWA council should be hired, but this may not be easy before substantial progress has been made.    Investment and budget  Defining and managing an overall budget is essential.    An example implementation plan is available here. Maker RWA Exposure Strategy over 12 months This section examines Maker’s RWA-related goals for the next year and provides an example table of targets:  842×247 39.8 KB   Legal  SPF: Requesting a SIF for Legal Defense Expenses  This MIP seeks the creation of a 5M DAI Special Purpose Fund for setting up a Self-insurance Fund (SIF) to reimburse MakerDAO participants for legal expenses in the case of legal or regulatory action against them. In its initial stages, the fund will cover the following:  Recognized Delegates Core Unit Facilitators Core Unit permanent contributors MKR holders who actively participate in governance   Risk  Subtle Attack Vectors on MakerDAO  In this post, Recognized Delegate @CodeKnight points out the need for more procedures for dealing with less overt attacks on the MakerDAO protocol. For example, he imagines a large MKR holder or group of MKR holders gaming Maker’s RWA investments by voting to give themselves below-market loans or perform other actions to siphon value from the protocol. These attacks are made easier by the high complexity of governance, low governance participation rate, and lack of disclosure requirements.    Research, Reports & Assessments  GUSD Institutional Rewards - Receiving Payments of Rewards  This post from the Collateral Engineering Services Core Unit explains the implementation of a smart contract for receiving GUSD institutional rewards from Gemini based on the amount of GUSD deposited in the GUSD PSM. Because the smart contract uses existing live contracts without direct authorizations on any Maker Protocol contract, the technical risk is considered low. The contract would work as follows:   Gemini sends GUSD rewards to the RwaSwapInputConduit2 contract.   The function push in the RwaSwapInputConduit2 can then be permissionlessly called by anyone to trigger a conversion of GUSD to DAI through the GUSD PSM and transfer the generated DAI to the RwaJar contract.   Once the DAI is in the RwaJar contract, anyone can call the function void to transfer the DAI to the surplus buffer. Authors: @nothsa and Artem Gordon PDF version   Three-Point Summary ‘What is the most relevant information on the forums this week for MKR and Dai holders?’ 1. The Strategic Finance Core Unit has released a dashboard allowing anyone to dive deep into Maker’s complete transaction history. 2. Maker’s newest Recognized Delegate, Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (HKUST), has arrived. Check out their platform here. 3. A new MIP aims to fund the development of a better monitoring system for RWA Vaults. Forum Recap:          Announcements & Updates  Maker Transaction Level Accounting Dashboard   “We are focused on finding adequate representations of the underlying economic reality of an on-chain protocol, with adaptations to the choices we make for representing smart contracts.”  The Strategic Finance Core Unit has used its experience analyzing MakerDAO’s protocol-level financial data to build a dual-entry ledge for on-chain accounting. The team hopes the ledger’s final unique features—real-time data, being independently verifiable and auditable, and open-sourced categorization choices—will bring us closer to developing a “gold standard for DAOs.” The dashboard allows any interested party to dig into individual transactions at the hash level for any figure on the MakerDAO balance sheet. SFCU welcomes feedback on this ongoing project.  November’s Financial Report  The Strategic Finance Core Unit’s monthly financial report for November 2022 is hot off the press. In summary:  RWA Vaults are coming online with a strong presence of productive stablecoin PSM vaults  MIP65 on track to deliver ~20M in annualized net interest income GUSD could deliver ~6M at current rates Blocktower could deliver ~6M at current rates MIP81 could bring another 15-30M at current updated rates, depending on Vault size   The DSR proposal passed, which could increase DAI expenses, depending on the amount of DAI locked There is ongoing compression in crypto-lending driving low-net interest income from Vaults  ~12M in annualized NTM net interest income     HKUST EPI Blockchain Delegate Platform  Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (HKUST) enters the arena as Maker’s newest Recognized Delegate with the following Core Values to drive their platform. HKUST EPI aims to present value to the protocol by:  Establishing a beneficial and friendly environment between Universities and Protocols. Developing innovative solutions through critical thinking. Educating the next generation about the benefits of blockchain technology in TradeFi. Supporting the protocol on Treasury, Budgeting, Process Streamlining, and Collateral Risk Management. And sharing their insights, industry knowledge, and experiences.  HKUST openly embraces the visions and innovation stemming from bleeding-edge technologies, and its students are actively encouraged to explore these new frontiers. Focus will be placed on several initiatives, including:  Actively participating in forum discussions. Initiating new improvement proposals. Monitoring protocol news and updates. Seeking consultations with respective faculty members or with collaborating external parties. Communicating with internal team members. And offering public Q&A with their delegators.  Check out this Meet Your Delegate call for a presentation and Q&A on their delegate platform.    Active Discussions & Proposals  Should Block Analitica have a $2.76M/year + 2400 MKR risk management?  This post from Recognized Delegate @pvl opens a discussion about the Risk Core Unit, its de facto control by private company Block Analitica, and whether the current risk model used by the team is appropriate. Risk Core Unit Facilitator @Primoz stepped in to share his thoughts and defend the CU’s work, and many others offered their feedback in the comments.  Tokenomics and Regulation  In this post, Recognized Delegate @CodeKnight asks what measures are planned for mitigating the legal implications of subDAO tokens potentially being classified as securities. @rune believes that subDAO tokens will not be considered securities provided that “real decentralization is in place,” but CodeKnight isn’t convinced.  MIPs  SAS Spending Permission  The Sidestream Auction Services Core Unit submitted a budget approval poll after their previous budget was rejected by governance. The team has considered Recognized Delegate feedback and shifted gears to focus on contributing to the Endgame as a “trusted custom software development service provider for MetaDAOs.”  Declaration of Intent to Develop a Comprehensive On-chain Monitoring Solution for RWA Vaults  With this MIP, Recognized Delegate @rspa points out the need for robust on-chain monitoring of RWA Vaults. Monitoring is as much as 13 months behind.  Remove MIP14c4: Protocol DAI Transfer Ceiling  This MIP from GovAlpha seeks to remove the DAI transfer ceiling set in place by MIP14, which defines the procedure for transferring DAI from the Maker Protocol to a target Ethereum address. Removing this limit avoids continually raising the ceiling via governance channels every month, an important consideration as GovAlpha expects MIP14 funding requests to increase during the transition to the Endgame.  Utilizing Hats Protocol  This MIP seeks to solidify a procedure for implementing Hats Protocol for Maker roles and permissions. Hats provide a more formal, structured way to maintain real-time, on-chain, verifiable roles in the DAO. This MIP contains four sub-proposals:  853×300 46.5 KB     Research, Reports & Assessments  MIP81 Coinbase USDC Institutional Awards by CES Domain Team  The CES Domain Team has published a technical assessment of two alternative implementations of MIP81. In the first alternative, MIP65 is implemented in a traditional custodial arrangement managed by a Real World Arranger through resolutions approved by Maker Governance. The second alternative is implementing a Safebox, which requires further development to comply with Coinbase’s legal and regulatory requirements. In addition, Safebox implementation provides the added benefit of improving on-chain transparency and enabling transfers to be completed on-chain without the involvement of any RWA counterparty. Institutional rewards will have to be validated off-chain in both implementations. Check out the complete assessment here. Forum Recap:          Announcements & Updates  Data API Breaking Change - Limit Parameter (16th January)  As of January 16th, the limit parameter will be restricted to a value between 1 and 100, as opposed to the unlimited range users previously had available. Default sorting is also being added to all response objects.    Active Discussions & Proposals  Endgame Asset & Liabilities Management (ALM) Technical Design  In this post, hexonaut of the Protocol Engineering Core Unit Team draws on SebVentures ALM Framework to outline technical approaches to bringing Maker into the Endgame. Three primary components must be in place for the transition: D3M V3, an ALM Controller, and PSM V2. For the D3M V3, at least two additions to V2 will be necessary:  A cash flow manager that handles what to do with profits and losses Extended protocol reporting covering Net Asset Valuation (NAV), Liquidity Profile, and Capital at Risk (CaR)  The purpose of the ALM Controller is to define the system’s constraints, such as max total exposure, liquidity, and peg management. Finally, PSM 2.0 must incorporate pooled liquidity, dynamic bonding curves, and algorithmic market operations.  MIP94: Implement a Feature to Refund People who Lost Money Sending Dai to the Dai Contract Address  This MIP, prompted by this post, seeks to enable users to retrieve their funds if they “passively and permanently” lock DAI in the DAI contract by mistakenly sending DAI to the DAI address.  How Core Units can work through the Endgame Pivot w/Tadeo of Data Insights CU on Drinks w/MakerDAO Delegates  Once again, the latest episode of Drinks w/MakerDAO Delegates has arrived!
